snippet.textDisplay:
Tbh, I never really enjoyed earthbound. The gameplay is not really fun.
However I actually kept playing, I really loved the music, the atmosphere, and the people. It was a fun, and relatable game, and the story was all right. This song though, definitely strikes up nostalgia from the era in which I first played this game. (Which was around 2013, on an NES emulator for my PSP) I did Everything I could on the PSP, and it was so great~. I occasionally go back to my PSP still, to see all the songs, Homebrew games, and saves I have on there. Man, so nostalgic! ❤️😊
snippet.textOriginal:
Tbh, I never really enjoyed earthbound. The gameplay is not really fun.
However I actually kept playing, I really loved the music, the atmosphere, and the people. It was a fun, and relatable game, and the story was all right. This song though, definitely strikes up nostalgia from the era in which I first played this game. (Which was around 2013, on an NES emulator for my PSP) I did Everything I could on the PSP, and it was so great~. I occasionally go back to my PSP still, to see all the songs, Homebrew games, and saves I have on there. Man, so nostalgic! ❤️😊

snippet.textDisplay: It doesn't matter what the different versions are called, the tune is called Pollyanna.
snippet.textOriginal: It doesn't matter what the different versions are called, the tune is called Pollyanna.

snippet.textDisplay:
Okay, let's take this from the top.
The melody of this track is known as "Pollyanna". This tune appears in every game in the Mother series: In the original as an overworld theme (like you said), in Earthbound as Ness' house theme (this track), and in Mother 3 in the Hall of Memories.
All clear now?
snippet.textOriginal:
Okay, let's take this from the top.
The melody of this track is known as "Pollyanna". This tune appears in every game in the Mother series: In the original as an overworld theme (like you said), in Earthbound as Ness' house theme (this track), and in Mother 3 in the Hall of Memories.
All clear now?

snippet.textDisplay:
I played this game very recently (I think in 2011), and I can tell  'ya, this is one of the best games I've ever played.
The first reason that I like this game, is the main character and his family. I think it's a little bit of my family(except that my Dad isn't a telephone).
The second reason, is because this game is beatiful in some way. I don't know, but every time I play this game, I feel it.
The third reason, the saoundtrack is AWESOME.

snippet.textDisplay: replaying Earthbound after playing through Mother 1 for the first time, this song in particular really moved me. Even though I played the games a day apart at most, I was struck by a nostalgic feeling when I recognized the melody. I don't know how Itoi does it, but he does it better than anyone else out there.
snippet.textOriginal: replaying Earthbound after playing through Mother 1 for the first time, this song in particular really moved me. Even though I played the games a day apart at most, I was struck by a nostalgic feeling when I recognized the melody. I don't know how Itoi does it, but he does it better than anyone else out there.

snippet.textDisplay:
I wasn't the biggest fan of Earthbound, but I always liked this theme.

If you get the chance, go on iTunes and get the Mother3+ soundtrack. It has some really good remixes and live performances, and the version of this song is excellent.
snippet.textOriginal:
I wasn't the biggest fan of Earthbound, but I always liked this theme.

If you get the chance, go on iTunes and get the Mother3+ soundtrack. It has some really good remixes and live performances, and the version of this song is excellent.

snippet.textDisplay: Nice Song ^^~~
snippet.textOriginal: Nice Song ^^~~

snippet.textDisplay: Ah, Pollyanna... This slowed down version is very relaxing. Also as a side note: After you save Paula, the Preschool's song turns into this. Random Fact while I was playing.
snippet.textOriginal: Ah, Pollyanna... This slowed down version is very relaxing. Also as a side note: After you save Paula, the Preschool's song turns into this. Random Fact while I was playing.

snippet.textDisplay: Another game that was never localised (at least for us poor europe folks). Come on nintendo, you gave us Mario RPG and Chrono Trigger, now we need this one!

snippet.textDisplay: I hate this game back in the day for some strange reason.  But I still played it and got to the end just cause! lol
